thread.title: Re: Duterte to spend first Valentine’s Day as president in Davao
thread.title_full: Re: Duterte to spend first Valentine’s Day as president in Davao

author: 18%grey
title: Re: Duterte to spend first Valentine’s Day as president in Davao
text:
By: Nestor Corrales - Reporter / @NCorralesINQ INQUIRER.net / 09:17 AM February 14, 2017 Rodrigo Roa Duterte was joined by his partner, Cielito “Honeylet” Avanceña, and their daughter Veronica “Kitty” Duterte as he headed for Malacañang for his inauguration as Philippine president. Photo by King Rodriguez/FILE PHOTO 
Where is President Rodrigo Duterte spending his first Valentine’s Day as the country’s chief executive? 
In his rest house in Carmen town in Davao del Norte, said Special Assistant to the President Christopher “Bong” Go. 
Go said Duterte would spend the whole day with his family. ADVERTISEMENT 
”Sa bukid sa Carmen mag Valentine’s Day si PRRD (President Rodrigo Roa Duterte) with family (The President will spend Valentine’s Day in the farm in Carmen with family),” he told reporters on Monday. 
Malacañang said the President has no scheduled events this Tuesday. 
Duterte, who has served as Davao City for more than two decades, has been living with his common-law wife Honeylet Avanceña and their daughter Veronica. READ: Who is Honeylet Avanceña, the woman behind Duterte? 
His marriage with his first wife Elizabeth Zimmerman was annulled in 1998. He had three children with Zimmerman–Paolo, Sara and Sebastian. 
Despite being annulled, the President remains in good terms with Zimmerman. During the Valentine’s Day in 2016, he gave her gave a bouquet of flowers and a cake.
